storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to view all active scheduling conflicts in a single interface to manage resolutions efficiently

testCases.title: Verify display of active conflicts with details
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least 3 active conflicts exist in the system
User has permissions to access conflict management interface
Test data includes conflicts with complete details (date, resource, severity, priority)

steps.action: Navigate to conflict management interface from the main dashboard menu
steps.expectedResult: Conflict management interface loads successfully and displays a list of all active conflicts with columns showing conflict ID, date, resource, severity, and status

steps.action: Select a specific conflict from the displayed list by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Detailed conflict information panel opens showing complete details including conflict ID, creation time, involved bookings, resource details, severity level, priority, and current status

steps.action: Verify conflict details displayed in the interface against backend data by comparing with database records or API response
steps.expectedResult: All conflict details match backend data exactly including timestamps, resource names, booking IDs, severity levels, and status information with no discrepancies

postconditions: Conflict management interface remains open and functional
No data modifications have occurred
User session remains active

testCases.title: Test filtering and sorting of conflicts
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
Multiple active conflicts exist with varying resources, dates, and priorities
At least 5 conflicts are present with different resource assignments
Conflicts have different priority levels (High, Medium, Low)
Conflict management interface is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to conflict management interface and locate the filter section
steps.expectedResult: Interface displays with filter options visible including resource, date, and severity filters

steps.action: Apply filter by selecting a specific resource from the resource dropdown filter
steps.expectedResult: Conflict list updates to display only conflicts related to the selected resource, other conflicts are hidden from view

steps.action: Click on the priority column header or select 'Sort by Priority' option
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are reordered and displayed from highest to lowest priority (High, Medium, Low) while maintaining the resource filter

steps.action: Click 'Clear filters' button or reset icon to remove all applied filters and sorting
steps.expectedResult: Full conflict list is restored showing all active conflicts in default order without any filters applied

postconditions: All filters and sorting are cleared
Full conflict list is visible
Interface is ready for new filter/sort operations

testCases.title: Ensure conflict status updates in real-time
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least one active conflict exists in the system
User has permissions to mark conflicts as resolved
Conflict management interface is open and displaying active conflicts

steps.action: Select an active conflict from the list and click 'Mark as Resolved' button or change status to 'Resolved'
steps.expectedResult: Conflict status updates immediately in the interface showing 'Resolved' status without requiring page refresh, and the conflict is visually distinguished (grayed out or moved to resolved section)

steps.action: Click the refresh button or reload the conflict management interface page
steps.expectedResult: The previously resolved conflict is no longer listed in the active conflicts section and does not appear in the main conflict list

steps.action: Navigate to conflict history or resolved conflicts section if available
steps.expectedResult: The resolved conflict appears in the history with updated status, timestamp of resolution, and resolver information

postconditions: Conflict status is permanently updated to 'Resolved' in the database
Active conflicts count is decremented by one
Conflict history log contains the resolution entry

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to modify or reschedule conflicting bookings directly from the conflict resolution interface to quickly resolve issues

testCases.title: Verify booking modification and validation in conflict interface
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least one active conflict exists with two or more conflicting bookings
User has permissions to modify bookings
Conflict resolution interface is accessible
Available non-conflicting time slots exist in the schedule
Real-time validation service is operational

steps.action: Open conflict resolution interface from the main menu and select a specific conflict from the list
steps.expectedResult: Conflict details page opens displaying all conflicting bookings with editable fields including booking time, date, resource, and duration fields enabled for modification

steps.action: Click on the booking time field of one conflicting booking and modify it to a non-conflicting time slot using the time picker or calendar widget
steps.expectedResult: System performs real-time validation and displays a success indicator (green checkmark or 'Valid' message) confirming the new time slot does not create conflicts

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Apply Changes' button to commit the booking modification
steps.expectedResult: Booking is successfully updated in the system, confirmation message appears, conflict status automatically changes to 'Resolved', and the conflict is removed from active conflicts list

steps.action: Verify the updated booking appears correctly in the main scheduling view with the new time slot
steps.expectedResult: Modified booking displays with updated time in the schedule, no conflicts are shown, and all related data is consistent

postconditions: Booking is permanently updated in the scheduling database
Conflict is marked as resolved
Schedule reflects the new booking time
No new conflicts are created by the modification

testCases.title: Test undo functionality for booking changes
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least one active conflict exists
User has permissions to modify bookings
Conflict resolution interface is open
Undo functionality is enabled for the current session

steps.action: Select a conflict from the list and modify one of the conflicting booking details (change time or resource)
steps.expectedResult: Booking modification fields accept the changes and display the updated values

steps.action: Click 'Save' button to apply the booking changes
steps.expectedResult: Changes are successfully applied, confirmation message displays, booking is updated in the system, and 'Undo' button or option becomes visible and enabled

steps.action: Click the 'Undo' button or select 'Undo Changes' option within the same session
steps.expectedResult: Booking immediately reverts to its previous state with original time/resource values restored, and confirmation message indicates successful undo operation

steps.action: Verify the conflict status updates to reflect the reverted changes
steps.expectedResult: Conflict status returns to 'Active' or original state since the resolution was undone, and the conflict reappears in the active conflicts list with original details

steps.action: Check the main scheduling view to confirm booking shows original values
steps.expectedResult: Booking displays with original time and resource allocation matching the pre-modification state

postconditions: Booking is restored to original state in the database
Conflict status reflects the undone changes
Schedule shows original booking details
Undo action is logged in system history

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want the conflict resolution interface to support filtering and sorting of conflicts to prioritize my work effectively

testCases.title: Verify filtering by date, resource, and severity
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler with appropriate permissions
Conflict resolution interface is accessible
Multiple conflicts exist in the system with varying dates, resources, and severity levels
Test data includes conflicts spanning at least 30 days with different resources and severity levels

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict resolution interface
steps.expectedResult: Conflict resolution interface loads successfully displaying all existing conflicts

steps.action: Locate and click on the date range filter control
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter dialog or input fields are displayed

steps.action: Enter a start date (e.g., 01/01/2024) and end date (e.g., 01/15/2024) in the date range filter
steps.expectedResult: Date values are accepted and displayed in the filter fields

steps.action: Apply the date range filter
steps.expectedResult: Only conflicts with dates between 01/01/2024 and 01/15/2024 are displayed in the conflict list. Conflicts outside this range are not shown

steps.action: Clear the date range filter and locate the resource filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: All conflicts are displayed again. Resource filter dropdown shows available resources

steps.action: Select a specific resource (e.g., 'Conference Room A') from the resource filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected and highlighted in the dropdown

steps.action: Apply the resource filter
steps.expectedResult: Only conflicts related to 'Conference Room A' are displayed. Other resource conflicts are filtered out

steps.action: Clear the resource filter and locate the severity filter control
steps.expectedResult: All conflicts are displayed again. Severity filter options are visible

steps.action: Select a severity level (e.g., 'High') from the severity filter
steps.expectedResult: Severity level 'High' is selected

steps.action: Apply the severity filter
steps.expectedResult: Only conflicts with 'High' severity are displayed. Medium and Low severity conflicts are filtered out

steps.action: Verify the count of displayed conflicts matches the filter criteria
steps.expectedResult: Conflict count indicator shows the correct number of filtered conflicts

postconditions: Filters can be cleared to return to the full conflict list
Applied filters remain active until manually cleared or changed
System maintains filter state during the session

testCases.title: Test sorting by priority and creation time
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler with appropriate permissions
Conflict resolution interface is accessible
Multiple conflicts exist with different priority levels (High, Medium, Low)
Conflicts have different creation timestamps spanning multiple days
At least 10 conflicts are available for sorting verification

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict resolution interface
steps.expectedResult: Conflict resolution interface loads with the default conflict list displayed

steps.action: Locate the sort options and identify the priority sort control
steps.expectedResult: Sort controls are visible with priority sorting option available

steps.action: Click on the priority column header or select 'Sort by Priority - Descending' option
steps.expectedResult: Sort indicator (arrow or icon) appears showing descending order is selected

steps.action: Observe the order of conflicts in the list
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are ordered from highest to lowest priority (High priority conflicts appear first, followed by Medium, then Low priority conflicts)

steps.action: Verify the first 3 conflicts displayed are all High priority
steps.expectedResult: First three conflicts in the list show 'High' priority label or indicator

steps.action: Scroll to the bottom of the list and verify the last conflicts are Low priority
steps.expectedResult: Last conflicts in the list show 'Low' priority label or indicator

steps.action: Locate and click on the creation time sort control or column header
steps.expectedResult: Sort indicator changes to show creation time sorting is active

steps.action: Select 'Sort by Creation Time - Ascending' option
steps.expectedResult: Sort indicator shows ascending order for creation time

steps.action: Observe the order of conflicts in the list
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are ordered from oldest to newest based on creation timestamp

steps.action: Verify the first conflict has the earliest creation date/time
steps.expectedResult: First conflict displays the oldest timestamp (e.g., created 30 days ago)

steps.action: Verify the last conflict has the most recent creation date/time
steps.expectedResult: Last conflict displays the newest timestamp (e.g., created today or yesterday)

steps.action: Toggle the creation time sort to descending order
steps.expectedResult: Conflicts are reordered with newest conflicts appearing first and oldest appearing last

postconditions: Sort order persists until changed by the user
Conflicts remain sorted according to the last selected criteria
Sort indicators clearly show the active sorting method

testCases.title: Ensure filter input validation and feedback
preconditions: User is logged in as a Scheduler with appropriate permissions
Conflict resolution interface is accessible
Filter controls are enabled and functional
System has validation rules configured for filter inputs

steps.action: Navigate to the conflict resolution interface
steps.expectedResult: Conflict resolution interface loads successfully with filter controls visible

steps.action: Click on the date range filter control to open date input fields
steps.expectedResult: Date range filter input fields are displayed and ready for input

steps.action: Enter an invalid date format in the start date field (e.g., '99/99/9999' or 'abc123')
steps.expectedResult: Date field shows the invalid input

steps.action: Attempt to apply the filter or move focus away from the date field
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed indicating 'Invalid date format. Please use MM/DD/YYYY format' or similar message. Error styling (red border or highlight) appears on the date field

steps.action: Clear the invalid date and enter a valid start date (e.g., '01/15/2024') and an end date earlier than the start date (e.g., '01/01/2024')
steps.expectedResult: Both dates are entered in the fields

steps.action: Attempt to apply the date range filter
steps.expectedResult: Validation error message is displayed indicating 'End date must be after start date' or similar message. Filter is not applied and conflict list remains unchanged

steps.action: Enter a future date range (e.g., start date: '01/01/2025', end date: '12/31/2025')
steps.expectedResult: Dates are accepted in the input fields

steps.action: Apply the future date range filter
steps.expectedResult: Filter is applied successfully. If no conflicts exist in the future date range, a message displays 'No conflicts found for the selected date range' or the list shows zero results

steps.action: Clear date filters and enter a valid date range (e.g., '01/01/2024' to '01/31/2024')
steps.expectedResult: Valid dates are entered and accepted

steps.action: Select a valid resource from the resource filter dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Resource is selected successfully

steps.action: Select a valid severity level from the severity filter
steps.expectedResult: Severity level is selected successfully

steps.action: Apply all valid filters together
steps.expectedResult: All filters are applied successfully. Filtered conflict list is displayed showing only conflicts matching all criteria (date range, resource, and severity). Success feedback or confirmation message may appear. Page loads within 3 seconds

steps.action: Verify the conflict count and displayed conflicts match the applied filter criteria
steps.expectedResult: Conflict count is accurate and all displayed conflicts meet the filter criteria. No conflicts outside the filter parameters are shown

postconditions: Invalid filter inputs are rejected with clear error messages
Valid filters are applied and conflicts are filtered correctly
Error messages are cleared when valid input is provided
System maintains data integrity and does not display incorrect results
